intro: Coluteocarpus vesicaria var. boissieri, commonly known as the Mediterranean bladderleaf, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Rutaceae, which includes citrus plants, and is characterized by its small, yellow flowers and pinnate leaves. The plant produces small, bladder-like fruits that contain seeds, a feature that gives it its common name. It thrives in dry, rocky soils and is often found in Mediterranean climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endemic species in certain regions.
